title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must identify the clause in the First Amendment that is common to both Engel v. Vitale (1962) and Zelman v. Simmons-Harris (2002).

For Task B the response must explain how the facts in Engel v. Vitale and Zelman v. Simmons-Harris led to different holdings in the two cases. The response for Task B may earn up to two points.

To earn one point for Task B, the response must describe relevant information (facts or holding) about the required Supreme Court case.

OR

To earn two points for Task B, the response must correctly explain how the facts in Engel v. Vitale and Zelman v. Simmons-Harris led to different holdings in the two cases.

For Task C, the response must explain how the holding in Zelman might affect educational policy in states with legislatures that support the ruling.

Points for Task A, Task B, and Task C are earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the prompt.
